subject: RE: [junit] RE: [OT] NoClassdefFoundError
msgSnippet: ... I don t know how a JVM typically works inside, but I don t see how you can get to this conclusion from your example. I d rather conclude that the class
messageBody:
> Apparently a lot of people are under the misapprehension that
> NoClassDefFoundError means that the class def was not found. That's
> not what it means.

I don't know how a JVM typically works inside, but I don't see how you can
get to this conclusion from your example. I'd rather conclude that the class
file is not was is meant by "class definition" in this case. It's probably
more like an internal representation of the class inside the JVM after the
class file got loaded.

Cheers, Ilja
